_header: The way of sleight and of soothness
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Lincoln College Lat. 52: not in this MS; Worcester, Worcester Cathedral Library F.19: not in this MS.
_description: On the ways to virtue, in the Fasciculus morum — one couplet

Bod332.Transcription:
þe wey of sleyȝte and of sothenesþe wey of strenthe
                    & of sobirnes

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Þe way of sleythe & of sothnesþe way of strenkeþe
                    & of methefulnes

BodLauMis568.Transcription:
þe way of sleythe & of soþenesseþe way of
                    strenghte & of mekenes

OxfCCC218.Transcription:
Þe wey of slythe & of [sothenesse]Þe wey of streyngthe
                    & of mekenesse
OxfCCC218.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 201.

CamGon71.Transcription:
Þe wey of sleyth & of sothnesÞe wey of strenkyth &
                    of soburnesse

EDU82.Transcription:
the waye of sleythe & of soþnesthe waye of strenght and of
                    mekenesse
